headline.main: Customizing a Diet To Stop the Yo-Yo

docs.lead_paragraph: LIKE an impassioned coach reviewing every punt, pass, tackle and block of a game just played, Cathy Nonas, the director of the Theodore B. Van Itallie Center for Nutrition and Weight Management in Manhattan, paced in front of a group of eight patients in a weight maintenance group last week and considered the food choices that each had made the previous day. Beef instead of fish at a dinner party? Fumbled pass. An extra glass of wine? Throwing an interception. But forgoing an hors d'oeuvre tray? Touchdown!
